}
Reasoning: Compounds that accept electrons are called oxidizing agents or oxidants. In redox reactions, oxidants gain electrons (are reduced) while causing other substances to lose electrons (be oxidized). O₂ and F₂ are classic examples of strong oxidants. Antioxidants do the opposite - they donate electrons to prevent oxidation. Oxygen is just an element, and residues are leftover materials.

"Reasoning": "Genetic drift is the random change in allele frequencies in populations, especially pronounced in small populations. Unlike natural selection which favors beneficial alleles, genetic drift can cause any allele (including harmful ones) to become fixed purely by chance. Natural selection typically eliminates harmful alleles, migration introduces new alleles but doesn't fix harmful ones, and mutation creates new alleles but doesn't fix them. Genetic drift is the primary mechanism by which harmful alleles can randomly reach fixation.",

There are no 'middle' or 'upper' ventricles in the heart - only left and right ventricles.

Carbon, argon, and sulfur are not waste products of photosynthesis.
